Description: Bowl of orange marl pottery , which has been pebble-burnished in vertical stripes on both the exterior and interior surfaces. The sides expand in a convex curve from the flat base to a plain rim, without turning inwards at the top. Good condition.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: For this site, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Naqada and Ballas' (London 1896). Like Late ware L17f in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Marked 331 on base.
